2009/12/8 snapmedown <snapmedown@...>
>
> I was thinking about much more digitization, down to 8, 4 or even 1 bit.
>
> With one bit, everything is reduced to variants of the logical operators. So we wouldn't even
> have to worry about weights only the "activation functions" ie: operators. We are likely to
> produce more structure, but that is what NEAT is good at.
>
> This makes the search space MUCH smaller,

If I'm following you right I think you just end up having to evolve
larger networks to represent equivalent functionality (to a normal
ANN). So you end up searching a /different/ fitness landscape* of the
same complexity, not a landscape with less complexity.

* More correctly a different version/transformation of the same landscape.


> People in this group have more experience with NN's so I am just looking for a feasibility
> assessment before I start programing it and possibly wasting my time.

Of course potentially I've completely missed the point :)

Colin.
